loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa, 45, lives in one of the remote areas of the Tabung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children, some of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To support this family, she and her husband have been growing rubber trees as their main source of income. She has been in this business for 45 years, and she is able to save KHR 22,000 per day.
 
This is the second loan for Channa’s group with VisionFund. She used her first loan successfully in improving her living conditions. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to lease more plots of farmland to grow rubber trees. She hopes this loan will enable her to plant rubber trees in a timely way so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To lease more plots of farmland to grow rubber.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sarom is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school. 

The main source of her family’s income is from working at the garment factory. She and has been in this business for seven years. With the current business, she can earn about US $8 per day. Her husband works as a paid worker to supplement the income. 

This is the fifth loan for Sarom with Kiva partner, VisionFund. She successfully used the past loans to improve her livelihood. Now she wants to use this loan to buy a motorbike for her family to use to reduce transportation fees.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family to use.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin, a vendor in the local market in Kandal province’s Kien Svay district, is 57 years old and blessed with seven children. Currently only two children are still dependent on her, as they are in school. To help Rin in generating more income, her husband is working at a construction site. Rin has been engaged in her current business for three years. This is not her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has returned her a decent income to deal with daily cost of living and to keep her children in school. However, recently Rin has been faced with financial issues, as her son needs to pursue his study, (majoring in engineering), at the local university in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Hence, she is applying for a new loan to pay for her son's tuition fees. She hopes this loan will provide timely financial support for her son so she can pay more attention in making more income for her household.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Alberto es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es casado, vive con su esposa. Alberto tiene  37 años de edad, es comerciante. Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de embutidos de fabricación casera, los cuales tienen mucha aceptación en la zona por la calidad del producto, lleva varios años realizando dicha actividad. Aparte de esta actividad también  trabaja en una fábrica de embutidos en forma aparte.
Adicionalmente durante su tiempo libre se dedica a la jardinería realizando principalmente trabajos de limpieza de patios para lo que cuenta con una desmalezadota, la cual adquirió gracias a un préstamo anterior que le fue concedido por la fundación. Es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logró construir su propia casa y equiparla adecuadamente.
El crédito solicitado es para compra de una máquina de moler más moderna y de mayor potencia para su fábrica de embutidos caseros.
texts.en:
Alberto is from the city of Carapeguá.  He is married and lives with his wife.  Alberto is 37 years old and is a businessman.  He makes a living producing and selling home-made sausages which, because of the quality of the product, are much liked in the area.  Alberto has been doing this work for some years but also works in a factory that produces sausages.

As well as his work, Alberto spends his free time doing gardening.  He mainly does work cleaning patios and so has a weeding machine, which he bought with the help of a previous loan from "Fundación Paraguaya".  Alberto is very self-sacrificing and hard working.  Thanks to his hard-work and dedication he managed to build and furnish his own home.

Alberto is applying for a loan to buy a more modern and powerful grinding machine to produce his home-made sausages.

loans.use: to buy a grinder to make sausages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support her studying.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a business man dealing in photography. The business has been in operation for two years and employs two other people. Alex also owns a barber shop. He was introduced to Milango by an employee and is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy a photocopying machine.
He had previously faced the challenge of lack of capital but sees that this can be eliminated by this loan. He now looks forward to a great business season.

loans.use: to buy a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for university fees and buy school materials.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, a citizen from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, is 50 years old and a married mother of four children. To provide for the family, she grows rice on a five-hectare area, and her husband catches fish to sell. She has been involved in her current business for 30 years, earning about 54,000 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle, she is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, which has upgraded her lifestyle in good condition. Now, she is seeking a new loan to support her business. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain more yield from her crop and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 55 years old, married with two children. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. Adil sells mixed products in the market. He started his business 20 years ago. His monthly profit is 150 AZN. He would like to earn more profits from his business.
He runs a small store selling grocery items to the people in his town. His customers are mostly his neighbors, who are looking for the affordable prices he offers.
Now he needs a 2000 AZN loan to buy shampoo, soap, powder, butter, tea, rice, and flour, etc. Adil wants to use the money from his new business to help his family and raise his children. In the future, he wants to have a big shop to sell food and detergent products. This will be more profitable for his business.
He hopes to improve his family's financial stability with this investment and enjoy a better quality of life. This is his second loan and he has a very positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Heat's Group

texts.en: Heat is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  She is a villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She grows rice, which she has been doing for 18 years. This is the third loan for Heat with VisionFund(Kiva's partner). She has repaid back her past loan complete and it has supported her business promptly. Now, she is requesting another loan from VisionFund and in group of three people as the leader. She and one of her co-borrower are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each while a remaining member is applying for 400,000 KHR. For Heat, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so she can set aside some saving for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. As a single parent, she works hard to provide for her children.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy more stocks of school supplies. The more items displayed at the store the better and the more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Mary Ann hopes for a continuous success in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share life and business of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of office and school supplies.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
This is Evelina, 60, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio, a taxi driver, and is the mother of their six children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelina manages her side car transportation business. She has one unit of side car or bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers to their destination within the community. Her regular customers are workers and employees in the community. She also has a direct-selling business for additional income. Every day, she earns a minimum of PHP 300 (Philippine pesos) in sales.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of her side car. 

Evelina hopes to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to have their own house and lot. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her side car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Tajy Poty está en el ciclo número 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les ayuda a saber el ingreso que cada una tiene, donde ninguna de las integrantes  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero pese a ello se esfuerzan siempre por no bajar sus ingresos.
La Presidenta es la señora Juana;  ella en su última encuesta aunque haya arrojado un resultado muy bueno sigue trabajando incansablemente para día a día ir superando todo tipo de obstáculos que se le presentan, pues cabe mencionar que ella gracias a su esfuerzo ya  posee su propio negocio de venta frutas, anteriormente lo hacía en forma ambulante y hoy día ya tiene su pequeño local en su propia casa.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Doña Juana solicita  este crédito para la compra de  más frutas de estación, debido a que tiene mucha demanda, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual contribuirá al aumento de sus ingresos y de esa manera mejorar la calidad de vida de los integrantes de su familia.
texts.en:
This is the "Tajy Poty" group and it is on its eleventh cycle in the women's committee programme.  Here all the members work and help each other to move forward.  The women are undergoing the poverty elimination survey, which helps to identify each entrepreneur's income.  In this group no member is living under the poverty line but still they must put in the effort so that their incomes do not fall.

The president of the group is Juana.  Juana's last survey produced a very good result and she is unstoppable in her work every day as she overcomes any obstacles that she faces.  It should also be mentioned that, thanks to her efforts, she now has her own fruit selling business.  Before she was a street vendor but Juana now sells out of her own home.  Juana is very hard-working and always puts in the effort to move forward in life. 

Juana is applying for this loan to buy more seasonal fruits as there is a lot of demand.  The loan will help Juana to put her business plan into action, which will help increase her income and so improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Josue David

texts.es: Don josue vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas en casa propia el tiene un molino en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a domingo con las señoras que hacen tortillas pues ellas llegan a moler el maiz para hacerlas con las ganacias que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, don Josue solicita un credito que le permita comparar herramientas como. discos, ejes y otras herramientas que son de mucha utilidad para tener en buen estado su molino, y asi poder seguirle dando a  su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Don Josue lives in his own home with his wife and two daughters. He operates a grain mill at his house. Josue works Monday through Sunday. The women who make tortillas bring him corn to grind. With the profit he earns, he is able to cover the household expenses.

Don Josue is requesting a loan so that he can buy equipment such as disks, shafts, and other parts that will be very useful in keeping his grain mill in good condition. This will allow him to continue providing for his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy disks, shafts, and other parts for his grain mill.

loans.name: Olympia's Group

texts.en:
Olympia is 60 years old and lives in Rizalina, Rizal Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married, with no children. 

Olympia is engaged in a buy-and-sell copra and charcoal business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials needed for house repair. 

Olympia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost seven years. In the future, Olympia hopes to expand her business.  

Olympia is the leader of a two-person group (Olympia's Group).  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials needed for house repair.

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh, head of the group, and all members of Kertha Bakti Group agreed to continue to have loans for businesses. They still need a loan to develop a business, raising pigs. They will stop borrowing until they have enough savings for their own capital.

With full support from her husband, who works as a farmer, Ni Luh will use the loan to buy two superior piglets for IDR 500,000 each. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feed. 

By still keeping the pigs for fattening, Ni Luh hopes there will be an increase in profits. For everyday needs, aside from her husband's income,  Ni Luh gets income from her garden and her other business selling religious articles for Hindusm.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as instant noodles, snacks, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Hanilet

texts.en:
Hanilet is 35 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hanilet runs a business selling pearls in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase different type of pearls to sell.

Hanilet has been in this business for six years.

In the future Hanilet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different types of pearls to sell.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jinky requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, wood etc for her business.

Jinky has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Jinky would like to save enough to provide security for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, wood etc for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has engaged herself in a hog fattening business. She is 49 years old and has been blessed with four children. With profits of her business, she sent her children to school. Within ten years of beginning to operate her business, she is earning an average amount of PHP 6,000 every selling time. Nonetheless, she earns not enough to provide for all their needs. Thus, Grace is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000, which she will use to buy two more hogs, feed and medicine. She hopes to earn higher-than-expected income, for the improvement of their living conditions, and to save for future uses, as well.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs, feed and medicine

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.en:
Porfiria is 64 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Porfiria works very hard to provide for them.
Porfiria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, bread, coffee, cooking oil, sugar, soft-drinks, etc. in her general store.
Porfiria has been in this business for 10 years.
In the future, Porfiria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, bread, coffee, cooking oil, sugar, soft-drinks, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly, 35 years old, is married to a farmer. They have been blessed with two children. She has managed a corn farming business at the village of San Pablo for almost 13 years. Harvest season in their area is only twice a year. After the last harvest she has a net income of 40,000 PHP. She would like a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM(Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has 4 children.She has a shop to generate income for her family and also has a coffee plantation. Virginia has been thinking of how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better after she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags. Virginia is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), who offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao is 57 years old, and is married with three children. Her husband works for a motorbike parking service. She has been running a general store in front of her house for ten years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Dao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food and many kinds of soft drinks to sell in her store.
She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy food and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Minandjangodo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MINANDJANGODO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Victoire est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Victoire âgée de 50 ans est  veuve. Victoire a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Victoire n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a seize ans que Victoire exerce comme activité, la vente de bois de chauffage et de maïs à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Victorine désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Victoire sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MINANDJANGODO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MINANDJANGODO Group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Victoire, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

Victoire is 50 years old and a widow. She has four children that she has to support. Some of them go to school. Victoire herself never attended school. For sixteen years, she's been selling firewood and corn at her home, a business which enables her to provide for her family without much difficulty.

She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. Eager to better satisfy customers' needs, she wishes to bolster her business. In order to do so, Victoire and  the other members of MINANDJANGODO Group are seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The previous loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Ahissou-Ve Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AHISSOU-VE est formé de six personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Agnès, est âgée de 57 ans. Agnès est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Agnès est une veuve. Agnès a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et un reste à sa charge. Agnès assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Agnès n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Agnès vend de l'akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs)à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution depuis vingt-un an, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Agnès désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Agnès sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AHISSOU-VE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
AHISSOU-VE Group is made up of six people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Agnès, is 57 years old. She's the one raising her hand in the photograph.

Agnès is a widow. She has four children, and some of them go to school. One of them is still in her care. Agnès takes care of the various household expenses on her own.

She never attend school. For 21 years, she's been selling akassa (a corn-based paste) at her home and through the distribution system, a business that enables her to provide for her family without too much difficulty.

Eager to better satisfy her customers, she wants to bolster her business. In order to do so, Agnès and the other members of AHISSOU-VE Group are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Luis Carlos tiene 55 años de edad y vive con su mama quien es una persona de la tercera edad y esta bajo su responsabilidad, el señor Luis Carlos es empleado de una tiene de abarrote es el ingreso que tiene para el y su mama. 
Esta solicitando un crédito KIVA para la terminación de un cuarto que esta haciendo en su vivienda ya que tiene que acondicionarlo a la comodidad de su mama, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario par realizar la mejora y comprar el material que necesita el se encargara de realizar la mejora ya que tiene conocimientos de construcción.
Desea mejor la calidad de vida y que su mama este en un lugar seguro y con la comodidad que necesita.
Con una parte de su sueldo que recibe de su empleo será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Carlos is 55 years old and lives with his elderly mother for whom he is responsible. He is employed at a grocery store and with his income he is able to support himself and his mother.

Luis Carlos is requesting a loan so that he can finish a room that is being built in his home. He wants to have it completed so that his mother will be comfortable, but he does not have the necessary funds for this project. Luis Carlos will buy the necessary materials to complete the job since he is knowledgeable about construction.

He wants to improve his mother’s quality of life by providing her a secure place with the necessary comforts. Part of his salary will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to finish the construction of a room.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Doña Flor de 35 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos en casa propia ella posee un negocio de venta de productos personales como ropa, perfumes, desodorantes, cosmeticos, etc tiene buena cleintela su negocio lo tiene en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza tiene buenas ganancias y puede cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, Doña Flor solicta un credito que le permita poder mas mercaderia que le permita poder tener mejores ingresos y seguir dandole lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
Doña Flor is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has a business of selling personal products such as clothing, perfumes, deodorants, cosmetics, and other items. Flor has a good clientele. Her business is located in her home and she has been making sales for several years. She generates good earnings and is able to cover all of her household expenses.

Doña Flor is requesting a loan so that she can buy more merchandise. This will enable her to generate more income so that she can provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, and other products.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Vicente” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Cada una de ellas tiene sus actividades diferentes, ellas se encuentran en una zona bastante alejada de los medios de comunicación, todas trabajan por ayudar a su barrio y que por medio del esfuerzo de ellas y sus vecinos puedan levantar su vecindario.
La Sra. Nadia es miembro, tiene una confitería y prepara tortas decoradas y por pedidos  ya tiene una buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy ricas tortas, recibe muchos pedidos y le esta yendo muy bien. Ella comenta que su sueño es que su comunidad vaya creciendo, que tengan un mejor acceso a la comunicación, y que los hijos de todos puedan crecer y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, levadura, huevos, dulces y demás para poder seguir haciendo las delicias que vende.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Vicente" was formed by several neighbors in the city of Santaní.  Each member has a different business activity and they live quite far from social media.  They all work together to help their neighborhood get ahead.

Nadia, one of the members, has a bakery and sells decorated cakes on an order basis.  She has many customers because of her delicious cakes, so she receives many orders and business is doing well.  She says her goal is for the community to continue growing so they can have access to the media so their children can grow and prosper.

She is requesting a loan to buy flour, yeast, eggs, sweets and other products to make the delicious products she sells.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, eggs, sweets and other products.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La  Srta.  Liz tiene 23 años de edad, es  soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por su hijo, para poder darle todo lo que el necesita y que no pase por ninguna privación.
Esta señorita es hija de una conocida artesana de la zona, ella desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar con su madre en el negocio y con la ayuda de ella logró montar su propio negocio que es la venta de sobrecamas y hamacas. Actualmente ya tiene clientela formada en la zona y así aumenta su pedido de productos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ya pudo hacerse de varias comodidades.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo, telas y otros que en esta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes, para poder seguir trabajando. Ella es una joven muy emprendedora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
texts.en:
Liz, 23, is single with one son and lives in the city of Carapeguá. She is a very hardworking and enterprising young lady who fights to give her son everything he needs and ensures that he is not struggling.

Liz is the daughter of an artisan who is well known in her area. From a very young age she began working with her ​​mother in the family business, and with her ​​help she managed to start her own business selling bedspreads and hammocks. Liz has already established a customer base in her neighborhood, and orders for her products are increasing. Thanks to her hard work and dedication she has able to produce a variety of items to order.

Liz is requesting this loan to invest in yarn, fabric and other materials this season to meet the demands of her customers, so that she can continue working. She is a young, enterprising fighter who wants to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase yarn, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora  está en su Sexto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que les permite conocer el nivel de ingresos de cada una, donde 3 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marite, quien se dedica a la venta de leche, cuenta ella que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, para que su producto ya este en la mesa de sus clientes para el desayuno. Es una persona muy sacrificada y emprendedora que se esfuerza por salir adelante y quiere ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual seguirá con sus ventas e invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Maria Auxiliadora" is in its sixth loan cycle and all the members have committed to working hard and helping each other get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey which allows them to know each member's income level.  Three out of 17 women are below the poverty line and have a very low income.

One of the members, Marite, sells milk for a living and says she starts work every morning very early so her customers will have milk for breakfast.  She is very self-sacrificing and enterprising and works hard to get ahead.  She wants to help her family through her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk so she can continue with sales to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 6º , ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es una forma de conocer como se encuentran ellas con sus ingresos, donde 3 de ellas se encuentran con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudelina, quien en su última encuesta  se vio que tenía un ingreso muy por debajo de la línea de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la costura y comenta que tiene un buen negocio ya que le esta yendo muy bien. Tiene buena clientela que siempre le trae muchos pedidos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por mejorar su vida y crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para poder telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir con su taller de costura y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Guapa" is in its sixth loan cycle.  The members are taking the poverty elimination survey in order to know where they stand with their incomes.  Three of them are at a very low level.

One of the members is Claudelina, who registered an income well below the poverty line on the last survey.  She works as a seamstress and says business is now going very well.  She has a good clientele and always receives many orders.  She is a hard-working, enterprising person who works hard to improve her lifestyle and development.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other supplies to continue with her sewing business and satisfy customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Primavera está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres,  son mujeres trabajadoras donde todas  se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas señoras ya están por encima de la línea de pobreza y otras están por debajo de la línea.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eva, quien en su segunda  encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza con ingresos medios. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, ella es modista y cuenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y buen trabajo ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela. Su sueño es poder tener un gran taller con el que podrá también ayudar a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás con lo cual podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y mejorando de esa forma en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primavera" is in its first loan cycle.  The members are hard-working women who help each other to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and some women are already above the poverty line.  But others are still below it.

One of the members is Eva, who showed a medium level income on the last survey.  Through her efforts and continued work, and by using the applications of vital behavior for a successful woman, she is improving her situation.  She is a seamstress and says that thanks to her efforts and hard work she has formed a good customer base.  Her goal is to have a large shop so she can also help other people.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies so she can continue investing in her busines and improve her business plan.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros;  Actualmente se encuentran  en el 4to  ciclo, con trece integrantes, queda 21 km de Curuguaty, donde todas trabajaran y se ayudaran para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 cuatro  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca, quien tiene una cantina con todo tipo de productos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en su negocio ya que tiene muy buenas ventas. Blanca quiere seguir trabajando ya que de esa forma puede ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, bebidas, jugos, comestibles y demás insumos para poder surtir su cantina y de esa forma seguir teniendo ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Guapa" got together at the initiative of one of its members.  The group, comprised of 13 members, is currently in its fourth loan cycle and is located 21 kms from Curugaty, where all the members work and help each other get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and four of the members are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Blanca who has a general store and sells all kinds of products.  She is a very hard-working, enterprising woman and says business is going very well because she has a high sales volume.  Blanca wants to continue working so she can help her family and give them all the things she never had.

She is requesting a loan to buy sweets, beverages, juices, food and other supplies to stock her store.  This is so she can continue earning an income to help her family.

loans.use: To buy sweets, beverages, juices, food and other supplies.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is a 50-year-old woman who relies on farming rice for an income. She also operates a sari-sari store business (variety store). She started her business 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and merchandise that she can resell in her store. She is hoping that she can continue her business and even improve it so she can have a good profit. 

In the future, Flaviana hopes to improve her inventory and introduce new merchandise for her customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and merchandise.

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É técnica administrativa. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, cimento, pedra, barrotes, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a casa e construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Judite is single and the mother of 2 children who go to school. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's an administrator. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, joists and others) to continue the building work on her home.

In future Judite hopes to complete her house and build a commercial establishment. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, joists and others) to continue the building work on her home.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is engaged in farming. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She also engages in a fishing business. Marites is asking for a loan to pay the school fees of her children. She believes that this loan can help her to send her children to school for a better education. In the future, she hopes to experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase Epson ink, printing materials, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Iolanda

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como activista. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, cimento, pedra, barrotes, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a casa para melhor confortara sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é angariar fundos para realizar os seus projectos
texts.en:
Iolanda is a widow and the mother of 3 children who go to school. She lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone else.

She works as an activist. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, joists and others) to continue to build her house.

In future Iolanda hopes to finish building her home and to improve her family's comfort levels. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, joists and others) to continue to build her house.

loans.name: Lúcia

texts.pt:
Casada e não tem filhos, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante, vende produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (carne, frangos, roupas usadas, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio para obter mais rendimento, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a trabalhar cada vez mais para obter fundos para poder realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Lúcia is married and doesn't have any children, lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a merchant and sells various products. With this loan she plans to buy products (meat, chicken, second hand clothing and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Lúcia hopes to grow her business in order to increase her income. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work harder every day to obtain sufficient funds to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: buy products (meat, chicken, second hand clothing and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: This marks Rose's sixth borrowing cycle from KADET; she plans to increase her charcoal stock this rainy season. She has paid her loan successfully, and given increasing demand of charcoal this season, she intends to stock more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to continue servicing her loan well just as she has done with previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Garmi

texts.en: Garmi is 32 years old and lives in Margibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She lives with her husband and children; all her children are in school and between the ages of nine and 13 years. For six years now, she has been selling palm oil in the market. Her aunt taught her how to make sales; her business makes more profit and it makes her popular. She asking for a loan to buy more palm oil for her business; she plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É fotografo de profissão e possui um estaleiro de venda de material de construção. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio construindo um estabelecimento comercial e adquirir uma viatura para fins comerciais, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é progredir ainda mais no seu negocio de forma a conseguir atingir o seu objectivo
texts.en:
Elias is married and the father of 1 son who is still too young to go to school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a photographer by profession and owns a store selling construction material. With this loan he plans to buy construction material (cement, sand and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future Elias hopes to grow his business by building another commercial establishment and purchasing a vehicle for commercial purposes. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to progress even further in his business so that he can reach his objectives.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, sand and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a food cafe that has been in operation for ten years. Hellen was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy a refrigerator. This is due to the challenge of food expiration in her business given that she buys fresh foods. Despite the high level of bad debts, Hellen believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide income to the other employees, and also use part of the money to purchase a parcel of land for future development.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Aren

texts.en:
Aren is 27 years old and lives with his mother in Vanadzor city. He has dreamed of becoming an engineer and being a student of Yerevan State Engineering University. But he hasn't managed to achieve this dream. After he served in the army he started to work in order to sustain his family. In 2008-2009 he trained in Moscow and used to work there for a short time.
After his return to his motherland Aren started to work in one of Vanadzor’s businesses as an electrician. His uncle, who is also electrician, has helped him by giving him the necessary knowledge. Now Aren is a good specialist and able to repair any electrical equipment and electrical appliances. Aren has a good reputation as an electrical equipment repairing master and have a lot of work in Vanadzor.
Now Aren is a skilled electrician and has worked in some different businesses supporting them with his electrical knowledge and is able to support his family needs.
Now Aren is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy some tools and equipment needed for his work.

loans.use: to buy some tools and equipment needed to repair electrical items.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a business lady living in Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of five children although only the last three attend school. She is a milk vendor, a business she has run for one year. Kadzo is applying for a loan of 15,900 KES to pay for her children's school fees. She looks forward to repay the loan from the proceeds of the milk sales.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Donna is a 39-year-old woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is married with one son, who is 14 years old. Donna relies on making brooms to support her family's needs. She started her business when her son was still a baby. She is asking for a loan to buy fibers, bamboo and paint for her brooms. Her income will be used for her family's food consumption and her son's school fees.
In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business with a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fibers, bamboo and paint needed to make brooms.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a trader living in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school going children and runs a retail shop which has been in operation for two years. Mercy is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy wheat/maize flour, rice, cereals, etc. to stock her store. She looks forward to growing the business and will save the extra income for future use.

loans.use: to buy wheat/maize flour, rice, cereals, etc. to stock her store.

loans.name: Mirshamil

texts.en:
Mirshamil is a 52-year-old with two children. It is already 24 years that he has been growing fruits and vegetables and selling them. His wife stays at home, but is usually helping him. His business is profitable, but he needs money to make improvements.

Mirshamil has worked in agriculture since he was young, and it is his only source of income. He grows potatoes, tomatoes, and fruits and works whenever necessary. He wants to use the loan to add more stock of green vegetables, fruits, and cereals. He hopes to expand his business and give his children a quality education. His monthly profit from this business is 143 AZN. Mirshamil needs a AZN 2,000 loan to expand his business. It is his second credit. He hopes the loan will help him expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has one child. A business woman, she has run a salon and boutique in the Mombasa area of Kenya for five years. She employs two other people.

Lucy was introduced to Milango by an employee. She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy new stock of clothes and cosmetics for ladies, kids and gents.

Despite the challenges of inflation, Lucy would like to grow her business and also own a beauty training school.

loans.use: To buy new stock of clothes and cosmetics for ladies, kids and gents.

loans.name: Qadiraga

texts.en:
Qadiraga, 52, has two sons and one daughter. With his son’s help, he sells food products at the bazaar from Sunday to Monday. This is the only source of income for his family. The monthly profit from this business is 180 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN). This profit is used for his family’s needs.

There is insufficient profit to reinvest in the business and cover customer demand. Qadiraga is suffering for this reason. He would like to invest additional capital in the business and increase his sales. 

For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase and diversify foodstuffs to sell at his store. This will be his fourth loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase and diversify foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of cosmetics, oils, shampoos, ladies' braids, etc.

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is a 30-year-old single woman. She sells food products in the bazaar. She has been in this business for two years. She lives with her parents, who help her, because Nigar's work is the only income in the family. Her father also helps her in this business.

The food products that Nigar sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 180 AZN. She is a very successful entrepreneur because she is in a good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

Nigar is now requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN to expand her business in the future. She has a good credit history, and this is her fifth loan.

loans.use: to expand her business in the future.

loans.name: Panambi Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Panambi está en su ciclo número TERCERO del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Beatriz, quien se dedica a la venta de tortas, ella es muy hábil en lo que hace y gracias a ello le va muy bien. Ella tiene muy buena clientela y se está esforzando por salir adelante, siempre ha luchado por su familia y quiere seguir haciéndolo. Su meta es poder tener una gran tienda donde vender sus tortas y por medio de esos ingresos ayudar a quienes la necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de harinas, huevos, manteca, dulces y demás para poder seguir haciendo las ricas tortas que vende.
texts.en:
This group, "Panambi", is on its third loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme, where everybody works and helps each other to move forward.

One of the group's members is Beatriz, who makes a living selling cakes.  She is very skilled in her work and so it is going very well for her.  Beatriz has a good customer base and she is making an effort to move forward.  She has always fought for her family and she wants to continue with this.  Her goal is to be able to have a big shop to sell her cakes and, with the income generated, she would like to give help to those who need it.

Beatriz is applying for this loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, sweets and more in order to continue making her delicious cakes to sell.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, sweets and more.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and lives in Margibi county, which is the largest rubber producer in Liberia, with her boyfriend and three children. Two of the children are in school and between two and 10 years old. For eight years now she has been selling rice by the cup, vita, pepper, etc., at her shop in the community. 

Mary started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She makes more profit and has more customers. Mary is requesting a loan to buy more rice, vita, & pepper for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more rice, vita, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 41 years old and lives with her husband and only daughter in Sevan city. Anahit is an accountant and has worked as a chief accountant at one of the organizations in Sevan city. Since 2008 she has also worked as a chief accountant at one of the sports schools of Sevan city. Her husband works in a flour mill plant as the head of production. 

Anahit’s daughter is a freshman at Yerevan State University in the faculty of romance and germanic philology. She is a promising student and already has good grades. She dreams of becoming a very good translator.

She and her husband work very hard in order to provide for their daughter's good future. Anahit now needs a loan from Kiva to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the semester.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold, 52 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Since 2010, his wife has been working as a sentry at the land-office. His elder daughter studies in the cooking profession at college and his son studies at high school. Ganbold has been rendering welding services to local people and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this profession. 

Ganbold is requesting a loan of MNT 1,100,000 to purchase seeds to plant vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, and beets, and to build a greenhouse on his ring of fenced land. As a result, the family will use their own vegetables as food and will save money. More importantly, building a greenhouse and growing vegetables will contribute to the efforts against air pollution by converting carbon dioxide into oxygen. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to grow vegetables and to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar, 24 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land.

He and his wife graduated from their respective colleges in 2009. He immediately began working as a sentry until employed as a plumber at a thermal power station. Even though his wife specialized in construction decoration, she now works as an assistant chef at a restaurant.

The house they live in has not been completed fully. Exterior layering work remains and the house floor needs improvement, so he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cements and planks. Using these materials, he can puddle exterior walls with bricks and cements as well as make a wooden floor. As a result, heat loss through walls will decrease thus enabling the family to burn less coal and therefore emit less smoke and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as bricks, cements and planks

loans.name: Amardelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Amardelger is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son works as an interior decorator at a private business entity while her daughter studies at high school. She herself has been rendering taxi services to local people on contract with a taxi company. 

She has purchased land which is 300 kilometers away from the city center and now one-third of the payment is remaining. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay the outstanding amount on the land. As a result, she can own land where she can build her own house, grow vegetables or rent at a higher price. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is bearing the whole burden of her family's finances.

loans.use: to pay the outstanding amount on a block of land

loans.name: Anzhelika

texts.ru: Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Анжелика приобрела и успешно реализовала партию обуви. В этот раз она просит  предоставить ей кредит на закупку детской обуви маленьких размеров. Анжелика целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. Большую часть прибыли она тратит на учебу дочери в институте в Киеве. Анжелика намерена развивать свой бизнес дальше, т.к. это единственный источник ее дохода.
texts.en: Thanks to a previous loan Angelica was able to purchase and resell a batch of shoes. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase children shoes in small sizes. Angelica is a goal oriented and hardworking woman. Most of her profits she spends on educating her daughter, who attends college in  the capital of Kiev. Angelica plans to further develop her business as this is her main source of income.

loans.use: to purchase children shoes for resale

loans.name: Gayratjon

texts.ru:
Гайратчон молодой,энергичный  парень в возрасте 26 лет.  Он пока еще не женат и живет со своими родителями.   Гайратчон живет по принципу, пока сам не накопит достаточную сумму денег для своей свадьбы, не женится.   Он очень трудолюбивый и хозяйственный человек.  
 Вот уже 9 лет как Гайратчон занимается купле- продажей орехов  со своей матерью. Этот бизнес у них является единственным доходом в семье.  Он  получает от этого бизнеса  хорошую прибыль.  Гайратчон приобретает орехи в другом городе и продает по дороже в своем селе.  
На данный момент Гайратчон хочет закупить орехов и с этой целью он обратился в Арванд за кредитом.  На полученный кредит он купит несколько мешков орехов и надеется на поддержку со стороны организации Арванд.
texts.en:
Gayratjon is a young, energetic guy, 26 years of age.  He's not yet married and lives with his parents.  Gayratjon lives by the principle of not marrying until he himself has not saved up enough money for his own wedding.  He's a very hardworking and hospitable person.  

For nine years he has bought and sold nuts with his mother.  This business is the sole source of income for the family and brings in a good profit.  Gayratjon buys nuts in another city and sells them at a higher price in his village.  At this time, he wants to buy more nuts, so he has turned to Arvand for a loan.  With this loan, he will buy a few bags of them.  He relies on the support of Arvand.

loans.use: to buy nuts

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz is 47 years old, married, and has two children, a 15-year-old and a 20-year-old son. Eyvaz has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. He wants his his sons to go into business. His younger son goes to school and his elder son goes to college. 

This is Eyvaz's first loan from Kiva. He started his taxi-driving business six years ago. Now he needs an AZN 1,500 (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to repair his car because his car has broken down. He is thankful to Komak Credit Union and Kiva for supporting him. He wants to use the money from his business to help his family and to change his car. 

In the future, he wants to buy a new car because this car is old and uncomfortable for passengers. This will make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a married mother of two and runs a food cafe, which has been in operation for two years. 

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 42,650 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc. Despite the challenge of seasonal changes, Naomi believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, and also use part of the money to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.ru:
Сергей родился . в городе Капан и проживает в селе Сюник.
После школы Сергей поступил в Ереванский Зооветеринарный институт, по специальности ветеринар. Сергей работает завучем в Капанской школе и в то же время с 2005года в селе Сюник занимается сельским хозяйством,скотоводством ,пчеловодством и держит кур.  Сергей  имеет собственную землю в  Сюнике где выращивает овощи, которые реализует в Капане и сеет сену, которую продает фермерским предприятиям.  

Сергей долгие годы занимается также пчеловодством. Он имеет более 15 улей и от реализации меда в рынках получает приличный доход. как говорит Сергей ,чтобы от пчеловодство получать хороший мед надо во первых очень любить пчел, заботится о них с большим терпением.

Сергей женат и имеет двух дочерей. В пчеловодстве и по сельскому хозяйству ему очень помогает его жена. 
С помощью первого кредита от Кива Сергей купил корову и рамки для пчел.
Сергею нужен кредит на сумму 300,000 Армянских драм для покупки новых улей, рамок и спецодежды для пчеловодства.
texts.en:
Sergey was born in the city of Kapan and now lives in the village of Syunik.  After school, he studied at the zootechnical-veterinary institute of Yerevan, specializing in veterinary science.  He now works as a director of studies in a school located in Kapan.  At the same time he has been involved in agriculture, animal husbandry, beekeeping, and raising chickens in his village since 2005.  Sergey owns some land in Syunik and he grows vegetables which he sells locally.  He also grows hay which he sells to a farming business.

Sergey has been involved in beekeeping for many years.  He owns more than 15 beehives and makes a decent income from selling honey at the market.  According to Sergey, in order to make some good honey, you need to first and foremost love your bees and to take care of them with a lot of patience. 

Sergey is married and he has two daughters.  His wife greatly helps him to manage his farming and beekeeping businesses.

Sergey needs a loan of 300,000 Armenian dram to buy additional beehives, frames and protective clothing for beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy new hives, frames and protective clothing for beekeeping.

loans.name: Bashkim

texts.en:
Bashkim wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to improve his mobile business of selling hamburgers. With the previous loan he bought tables, chairs and an umbrella and was able to increase his business profit. He used these profits to help his family and managed to improve the condition of his family life. Bashkim is very satisfied with his business and is planning to continue in the future. 

Bashkim is now requesting a second loan for this business to buy a new big table and umbrella. This loan will allow him to have a working table and to transform his business from mobile to permanent. In the future he hopes to increase, expand, and generate income from his business even more, like owning a big fast food shop, and provide a secure life for his family. 

He would like to thank Kiva lenders again for their support the second time!

loans.use: to buy a table and an umbrella.

loans.name: Odhuu

texts.en: Odhuu is 27 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a house in Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Bazargur is 27 years old and works in a local company. Her children Enhtulga, age five, and Enhsuvd, age three, go to a local kindergarten. She has been running her organic dairy products sales business in a local market since 2012. She has built a closer relationship with her customers and suppliers over the period and now she is requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, friendly and positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders and sell to local customers

loans.name: Ayora

texts.ru: Айёра умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. После окончания средней школы она поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет. Окончив отлично университет по специальности программиста, она осталась работать в университете. Более 7 месяцев она работает программистом в Таджикском Государственном Университете. Она очень любит свою работу и много времени проводит на работе. Она последнее время не успевает по домашним делам, например для нее очень тяжело стирка одежд. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для покупки стиральной машины. Этот займ поможет ей своевременно выполнять домашние дела и больше заняться с любимой работой. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ayora is an intelligent and hard-working woman. She is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. After graduating from high school, Ayora entered the Tajik State University. Following graduation as a software programmer with excellent marks, she stayed at the university and has now worked there as a programmer for over 7 months. Ayora loves her work and spends a lot of time at her job. Lately, she's been falling behind with her household chores - for example, she finds it difficult to find enough time to wash her clothes. Ayora is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a washing machine, which will help her to take care of household tasks quickly and spend more time at her favourite job. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her household

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Мавчуда добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 сына. Мавчуда всегда старается найти новый источник дохода и улучшить условию проживания. Мавчуда с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству и поэтому имеет большого опыта по данному отраслью бизнеса. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота. Ее сын обещал помогать ей введение бизнеса. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она получила много новой информации и благодарно за этот курс. 
Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavchuda is a thoughtful and determined woman. She is 45 years old, married, and and is raising one son. Mavchuda is always trying to find a new source of income and improve their standard of living. As a child she helped her parents raise livestock, which gave her an enormous amount of experience in this field of business. Now she is planning to start her own business selling livestock. Her son has promised to help her run the business. She took a course offered by the Businesswomen's Association called "Getting Ahead" and received a certificate. She learned much from this course. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy cattle to start her business. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for ten years. In this business, he sells retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, and cooking oil. He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is lack of capital. 

Tonny is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a 33-year-old lady from Migosi location in Kisumu, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports five people in her family. 

Caren is married to Solomon, who is a business man who provides little support to the family.  She has four children between the ages of one and eleven.

She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last three years, and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 40,000.  Caren is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to diversify in other businesses, such as selling shoes.

She has a dream of providing for her family needs by making the business more stable.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Усмону 26 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка. Усмон вместе с семьей живет в районе Шахритуз в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Климат района подходит для ведения сельского хозяйства, поэтому многие жители района, в том числе и Усмон занимаются этим видом деятельности. Одновременно Усмон занимается ремонтом домов. Сейчас Усмон хочет начать бизнес в области животноводства, а именно заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Для этого у него есть сарай для содержания скота и машина для перевозки корма скота из базара в дом. Усмон берет кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Usmon is 26, married and has one child. He lives with his family in Shahrituz in southwestern Tajikistan. The climate is good for growing crops, and so many of the residents of the area, including Usmon, work in agriculture. Usmon also repairs houses. He wants to start his own business raising livestock, in particular, raising, fattening, and selling cattle. He has a shed for sheltering the cattle and a car for hauling animal feed from the market. Usmon is requesting a loan to buy, raise, and sell cattle.

loans.use: to buy and raise cattle

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en:
This is Alimamy, who is 26 years old.   He is single, and has no child.   He has one  dependent, a sales assistant. 

In 2005, Alimamy established his business of selling mobile-phone credit-card vouchers, charging phones, and selling drinks. He began his business because he had no financial support to continue his education. His business is located in City Center.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 300,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to buy more drinks.  He hopes that this loan will help support him.  In the future, Alimamy plans to further his education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a shop. In this business, she sells foodstuffs, household goods, etc. She has also set up a tailoring business.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is seasonality. 

Lucy is applying for a loan of 31,450 KES to buy materials to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to sell.

loans.name: Yal

texts.en:
Yal is a 36-year-old businessman who live in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 10. All of them go to school. 

Yal runs a furniture-making business, and he has been in business for six years. He has one employee. In addition to this business, he has no other source of Income.

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4000 SSP to purchase more metal and many other items. 

In five years Yal would like to expand his business and open other branches.

His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Yal says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making beds, doors, etc.

loans.name: Shermuhammad

texts.ru: Шермухаммад родился в районе Шахритуз на юго-западе Таджикистана. Ему 28 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Шермухаммад получил только среднее образование. Он на своем небольшом участке земли занимается земледелием.  Сейчас он решил попробовать себя в сфере животноводства. Шермухаммад построил коровник для содержания скота и обратился за кредитом, чтобы начать бизнес. Шермухаммаду в разведении скота будет помогать его семья. Он просит кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Shermuhammad was born in the Shahrituz region in the south-west of Tajikistan. He is 28 years old, married, and a father of three. He only received secondary education.

Shermuhammad has been engaged in farming on his small plot of land, and has now decided to test the waters of animal husbandry. He has built a cow shed for keeping cattle and applied for a loan to start his new business. Shermuhammad's family will help him tend the livestock. He is requesting this loan to purchase cattle for subsequent resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle for raising and subsequent resale

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah is 33 years old, married, and lives in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia because it is the capital city of Liberia. She is a high school graduate.

For three years she has been involved in the sales of fashion dresses and fabric (traditional cloth). She has many customers because she sells quality products. She started this business with money from her grandmother and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She spends eight hours, six days a week, on her business. One of the problems she faces is vehicle traffic, so sometimes she is late getting her shop open. 

Tawah is requesting a loan to buy more fashion dresses and fabric to increase her sales. She plans to establish another shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fashion dresses and fabric to increase her sales.

loans.name: Dorotia

texts.en:
Dorotia lives in Malindi and is grateful for the previous loan she received through Milango. She would like to increase the stock of items in her salon in order to continue offering beauty services to her customers. She mainly supplies beauty products like creams and conditioners.

Dorotia is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase salon products, such as cosmetics (creams and conditioners). Her aspiration is to open a larger salon despite the challenge of seasonal sales periods. 

She will use the extra income from this loan towards her child's education and to purchase a parcel of land.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics for her shop.

loans.name: Sayram

texts.ru: Сайрам 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Детям 25, 22 и 18 лет. Ее муж пенсионер и получает маленькую пенсию. Сайрам работает в государственной организации по охране природы и экологии более 32 года. Сайрам очень любит свою работу. Так как она с детства любила такие предметы, как биология, экология и география. Сайраму очень интересно ее работа. Сайрам уже несколько лет хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег, так как она тратит все свои деньги для покупки продуктов питания. Она должна отремонтировать все комнаты, так как все комнаты в плохом состоянии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски, обои и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sayram is 50 years old. She is married and has 3 children who are 25, 22 and 18 years of age. Her husband is retired and receives a small pension. For over 32 years, Sayram has worked for the branch of the federal government dedicated to protecting the environment and ecology. She loves her work as she has been interested in biology, ecology and geography since childhood.

For several years, Sayram has wanted to repair her house. However, she lacks the means to do so as she spends all her money on food. She needs to repair every room in the house as they are all in poor condition. Sayram is requesting a loan of US$900 to purchase building materials such as cement, paint, wallpaper etc. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, paint and wallpaper for repairing her house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married business man and runs a mobile money trasfer shop, which has been in operation for three years. He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to increase the float for the till. 

Despite the challenge of delays in transmitting transactions, Joseph believes the business has great growth potential.

loans.use: to increase the float in the till.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Samar is a 29-year-old married young woman; she is the mother to one son and one daughter.  Her husband is employed and gets a small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Samar is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will allow Samar and her family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase living room furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pay for labor  for her farm.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped her to boost her business. She is now asking for another loan of 40000 KES to supplement her business by buying more goats to sell. This will enable her support her children in the future. She thanks Kiva users for their support.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata's Group

texts.en:
Fatmata's Group consists of teachers based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) for 18,200,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they can meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can repay the loan. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Brima is the leader of these teachers. He is 57 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. He is a native of Masokeh village, in northern Sierra Leone. Brima has been a professional teacher for 36 years. He is requesting this loan, which he will use to buy house building materials, such as sand and cements, for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase house building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 35 лет. Она имеет очень тяжелую судьбу, так как ее любимый муж умер, и она осталась вдовой с 4 детьми. Мухаббат более 10 лет работает кассиром в авиа кассе. Она имеет большой стаж и хорошо знает все тонкости своей работы. Она упорно работает для того, чтобы обеспечить своих детей хорошим условием проживания. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом очень старый и имеет плохое состояние. Ее дети очень обрадовались, когда узнали об ее плане. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, песок, краски и.т. Она ждет вашу доброту.
